definitions.definition: A hat made from the fur of the beaver.
A heavy quality of broadcloth for overcoats.
Any of various nymphalid butterflies of the genus Ariadne, of Africa and Asia.
A variety of petalite found in Elba.

definitions.example: a caster of spells; a caster of stones; a caster of bronze statuary; an online caster of video games

definitions.definition: A wheeled assembly attached to a larger object at its base to facilitate rolling. A caster usually consists of a wheel (which may be plastic, a hard elastomer, or metal), an axle, a mounting provision (usually a stem, flange, or plate), and sometimes a swivel (which allows the caster to rotate for steering).
definitions.example: Many office chairs roll on a set of casters.

definitions.definition: A shaker with a perforated top for sprinkling condiments such as sugar, salt, pepper, etc.
A stand to hold a set of shakers or cruets.
The angle of the axis around which a car's front wheels rotate when the steering wheel is turned, with a vertical axis being defined as zero caster.
